snippet: Wall Street bet big against President Obama, and lost. | Lobbyists are making an effort to temper financial regulations. | The Carlyle Group swings to a profit. | Xstrata shareholders are getting conflicting signals about whether to approve the...
abstract: Wall Street bet big against President Obama, and lost. | Lobbyists are making an effort to temper financial regulations. | The Carlyle Group swings to a profit. | Xstrata shareholders are getting conflicting signals about whether to approve the takeover offer by Glencore.

headline.main: In Washington, Wall Street Turns to Damage Control
